column4: hello, i'm running ubuntu 9.10 but when pinging seems to be very slow as well as traceroute. when i ping, the ping times are very low (17 ms to google.com) but there's a large amount of time between pings, which is unusual. traceroutes also occur very slowly---it's about five seconds in between each line. on other computers, pings have 1 second in between and traceroutes are almost instantaneous, as expected. i've tried two different
NICs on this comp and both show slow traceroutes and slow pings
1 second is supposed to be default, what if you do: ping -i 1
yes, but how does knowing that help me?
umm.. did you try ping -i 1
oh sorry, i misread what you said. yeah, when i do ping -i 1, there is still a 5 second delay between pings
that's odd
6 packets transmitted, 6 received, 0% packet loss, time 25141ms rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 14.717/15.372/15.806/0.443 ms
you can see the average ping time is 15 ms but the total time for 6 packets is over 25 seconds
how about: sudo ping
and/or sudo ping -i 1
the problem is still there. and AFAIK, ping is install and suid anyway since you need to be root to send raw ICMP packets
ping is installed as suid*
I can't say I've ever encountered this problem
with ping -i .2, it's still 5 seconds between pings
actually, let me try changing the port on my router. maybe this port is bad
so brb
could someone have setup an alias?
but traceroutes are slow as well
and i'm the admin user here and i never set up any alias
yes, i can confirm it's not the router port. i switched the ports on a router with another computer but this computer is still slow with ping and traceroute and the other pings and traceroutes fine
doh... I recently started using google's dns servers
